name: CPS Technologies Corporation
description: CPS Technologies Corporation is a leading manufacturer of advanced materials and components, primarily focused on specialized metal matrix composites. Founded in 1981, CPSH has established itself as a pioneer in innovative material solutions for a variety of industries, including aerospace, defense, automotive, and electronics. The company's core expertise lies in its proprietary processes that enable the production of high-performance materials that are lightweight, durable, and cost-effective. CPSH's products include advanced armor systems, heat exchangers, and various custom components designed to meet the unique needs of its clients. The company is committed to research and development, continuously seeking to enhance its offerings and expand into new markets. With a dedicated focus on quality and customer satisfaction, CPS Technologies aims to deliver superior solutions that drive efficiency and performance in its customers' applications. The company’s vision is to be the preferred partner for advanced materials and manufacturing solutions, leveraging its innovative technologies to support the evolving demands of the global marketplace.

seo.meta_title: CPS Technologies Corporation | Advanced Materials & Manufacturing Solutions
seo.meta_description: Explore CPS Technologies Corporation, a leader in advanced materials and manufacturing solutions. Discover innovative products and technologies designed for high-performance applications.

faq.question: What does CPS Technologies specialize in?
faq.answer: CPS Technologies specializes in advanced materials and metal matrix composites for various industries.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of CPS Technologies?
faq.answer: Diane A. McCarthy is the CEO of CPS Technologies Corporation.

faq.question: Where is CPS Technologies headquartered?
faq.answer: CPS Technologies is headquartered in North Attleboro, Massachusetts, USA.

faq.question: What are some of CPS Technologies' main products?
faq.answer: CPS Technologies' main products include metal matrix composites, specialty armor systems, heat exchangers, and electronic packaging components.
